text: Hi all, i have couple of tables in HubSpot with dynamic pages. they are products. is it possible to list all the product from all the tables in one listing view??
if all table contains product, why you have multiple tables ??
As far as I’m aware that’s how multi-level dynamic pages work - you need to have multiple tables to have a nested URL structure

So if you want
/products/category-1/product-X
/products/category-2/product-Y
/products/category-3/product-Z

you need the following tables:
All products
Category-1 products
Category-2 Products
Category 3 Products

Hi,
Does someone know why my image is not resized using `{{ resize_image_url(slide.background_image.src, 0,0,1536,true) }}`

Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
If the image is over 2500 pixels it will not resize or it could just be that it needs a little bit of time to set because we found that it's not always instant

hello friends,
I want to set the search engine of a HubSpot site. The search must be done only on the title of the page and the description and not on the content.
I must exclude the content of the page from the search because it returns too many results.

Can you help me please?

Thanks for the reply Kieran, you still run into the same difficulty there. You're using {% for content in contents %} So for example if you blog is set to show 18 posts per page {% for content in contents %} will loop through 18 posts.  {% unless item.is_featured %} will remove the featured post, making new_contents 17 posts whenever the featured post is present in contents.
Hello! This is an issue that I have been dealing with for a while, but wondering if anyone can help me out. It seems the styling hierarchy is off with the age gate?
